symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.pattern: Present in most cases, can resolve within days

symptoms.name: Myalgia
symptoms.pattern: Predominantly in the trunk (chest, epigastrium), can also affect extremities; intermittent intensification, exacerbated by movement and breathing

symptoms.name: Low back pain
symptoms.severity: Acute episodes, can hinder daily life
symptoms.pattern: Reported in some cases, may mimic acute purulent spondylitis and discitis

symptoms.name: Orchiodynia
symptoms.pattern: Reported in some cases, particularly in males

symptoms.name: Muscle weakness
symptoms.pattern: Predominantly affecting proximal muscles of extremities

physical_findings: Pain upon spinal percussion (limited to 4th and 5th lumbar vertebrae)
Severe myalgia and muscle weakness predominantly involving the four extremities; however, no redness, swelling, or local warmth was noted
No rashes or abnormal joint findings

lab_values.coxsackievirus B3 neutralizing antibodie: Significant increase in paired serum samples

risk_factors: Contact with individuals with acute upper respiratory tract infections

required: Clinical presentation consistent with epidemic myalgia (fever, severe myalgia)
Significant increase in enterovirus-neutralizing antibodies (e.g., Coxsackievirus B3)
supportive: History of contact with infected individuals
Absence of abnormalities on imaging studies (CT, MRI)
